tafsirQuiz.question: Which concept is emphasized in Surah Al-Hujurat, Ayah 1?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Subsequently, this meant the forming of opinions in disregard of the guiding principles laid down by God and His Prophet. If he came to know that his utterances reached God before they reached other human beings, he would prefer to remain silent rather than talk
distractors: This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Now this divine guidance necessitates obedience just as obedience to the Prophet personally was required during his lifetime. The Bedouin tribes from the areas surrounding Madinah were not mature in understanding
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who tread the path of righteousness and guidance develop an entirely different temperament from those who do not. Being of such a nature is an indication of their having been blessed with a share in God’s Graces
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: If two Muslims quarrel with each other, other Muslims should never add fuel to the fire. On the contrary, under the influence of brotherly feelings, they should make every effort to bring about a compromise between the two
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: That is why, if a man finds some weakness in another man, he makes a point of highlighting it, so that in this way he may prove himself to be great and the other small
distractors: This verse gives rulings on trade and commerce
This verse narrates a historical event
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The root of many social evils is unfounded suspicion. His fear of God will warn him about his mistake and consequently he will give up his wrong approach and seek God’s pardon
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets
This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Indeed, many evils have stemmed from these differences being used to discriminate between one person and another, between one community and another, between one nation and another
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Hujurat, Ayah 14?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who accept the Faith of God in this manner acquire eternal conviction. One may perform some righteous deed then think it necessary to announce the fact, but such announcement actually has a nullifying effect
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers
This verse explains the rules of inheritance
This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Faith and good deeds all depend on God’s directive guidance. If anyone embraces Islam or some Islamic task is accomplished through him, he should realize that this has come about with the help of God
